edge_media_to_caption:
Taking pasta night up a notch with this Broken Lasagna w/ (#vegan) White Pesto & Broccoli Rabe 💪🏼 While it may sound a little fancier than you’d like for a weeknight meal, it’s actually a 2-bowl deal that comes together in about 20 minutes 👊🏼 The vegan white pesto is a game changer (thanks @bonappetitmag for the inspiration ✨🙌🏼), where plant-based ricotta is at its base, along with some reliable pantry staples. One of our favorite summer meals to date!
(Recipe link in my profile 🍝💚) #foodandwine #FWhealthy #thekitchen #feedfeed #iamwellandgood #onthetable  #f52extra #f52grams #bareaders #plantstrong

A meal prep worthy jar of Garlic, Herb & Shallot Confit that can last up to a couple months in your fridge 👊🏼 (if you can make it last that long). I’m not sure if it’s all the summer bounty that’s making me want to preserve it all, or the very real nesting phase I’m going through at the moment (bc 8 months pregnant🤰🏻). Either way, making vegetable confit is one of my favorite ways of preserving the season, and using it for multiple meals throughout the week! 
Head over to the blog for the recipe and a whole host of recipes you can use the confit for 👌🏼✨(Link in my profile)
When the process is prettier than the outcome 💞

Officially back on our feet after the stomach virus took us all out for the past week 😅🙃 I’ve never been sick while so pregnant, plus taking care of a wild little human (Amesy) - it all just about sent me over the edge. But we’re back! And things are normal-ish (even if frank and me are eating the worlds blandest foods at the moment), so I am very much grateful 🙏🏼 But! First thing I’m making when I’m fully functioning are these (#vegan #grainfree #glutenfree) frozen chocolate chip cookie dough balls 💃🏻 They chill in the freezer until you want one, then let it sit for about 5 mins and you’re good to go. Super easy, super delish, I know you’re gonna love them 💕 Go get the recipe link in my profile ✌🏼😘

Recently inhaled: @bufcreamery burrata broiled on (#glutenfree) @gjusta bread, topped with today’s shallot, garlic & herb confit (more in my stories), s & p, and thyme 👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼10/10 recommend this, or some form of it 🤤
Frozen chocolate cookie dough balls are where it’s at when temps are in the 90’s 😅🙌🏼🍪

It’s Sunday, which means we’re prepping another sauce/dressing/dip/condiment for the week! This week it’s my everyday #vegan Caesar dressing, that takes maaaaaybe 5 minutes-ish to whip up 👌🏼 It’s a go-to prep sauce because it’s more than just a salad dressing. Use it to drizzle over diced up veg for snack (peep my previous IG post), or you can dip your grilled veg kabobs into it (like we did last night 🙌🏼). Better yet, toss it into your fave protein salad of choice for a creamy punch. Either way, this sturdy go-to will add a bit of ease to your weekly meals - promise 👍🏼😘
(Recipe link in my profile 💛)
Righteous little nosh - cukes 🥒with a good dousing of a homemade vegan Caesar dressing 🙌🏼 I don’t know why I waited until now to use this dressing on more than just salad 🤷🏻‍♀️
Creamy pesto pasta 🍝 The ultimate weeknight dinner go-to 💚 Also happens to be #vegan thanks to some 🥑 thrown in the pesto 👌🏼

This Sunday’s sauce happens to be my favorite flavor bomb: Garlicky Turmeric Sauce 💛⚡️✨ It’s also a great sauce to have on hand for meals throughout the week: drizzle over lunch/dinner bowls, jazz up your traditions potato salad, mixed into chicken or crushed chickpeas for a protein salad sitch, etc., etc! 
Recipe link in my profile ✌🏼💛

Officially summer sandwich szn! 🥪🥪🥪🥪 I’ve got these beach/picnic-ready niçoise sandwiches up on the blog this week that are so 👌🏼👌🏼 The shallot, balsamic, kalamata vinaigrette alone makes for the best companion to any sandwich really. You can find both recipes through the link in my profile 🤗 Cheers to Friday, and the weekend 🙏🏼

When Tuesday doubles as a work day AND a day to food prep for your fam. 😅 It was a very full weekend, from pure ease to extreme chaos, and I completely neglected my usual Sunday food prep routine for more fun things. So today was a hustle. 
Got back into the swing of things by prepping at least 2 meals, 2 sides, and this ☝🏼reliable topping that triples as a dip, sauce, and/or dressing for whatever you need it to be. 
These little do-it-all sauces are what gets me by during a busy week - something easy to grab, and make preparing a meal a bit more fluid. Sharing this recipe for a Pepita-Poblano Romesco Sauce on the blog this week, along with a few ways I make use out of it throughout the week 💚💚 Hoping this brings some ease into your kitchens/lives as well 💛
(Recipe link in my profile)
Cold & cloudy Sunday w/ a wild little toddler (🤪) calls for box mix waffles piled with coconut yogurt 🥥, toasted hazelnuts 🌰, and lots of maple 🍁.

Crispy Smashed Potato Salad w/ Garlicky Yogurt Dressing & Pickled Red Onions is here to say 👋🏼 And to let you know that there’s no better way to welcome the unofficial beginning of summer than with these babes ☀️⛱ 🏄🏻‍♀️
(Get the recipe link in my profile 😎)

Don’t know what to do with all that asparagus? I’ve got 7 different recipes, with 7 different ways of preparing it up on the blog 👊🏼 This one’s a quick sauté with fresh peas, broccoli rabe and a chive-y chickpea mash underneath. You can get the link to all the goodness in my profile 💚🌿💚🌿
An iced sunshine latte and the last of the honeysuckle blooms 🌼✌🏼
Shot this recipe today and had all to do to not eat the entire plate before dinner 🤤 Serving up this crispy, smashed potato salad next week on the blog 👊🏼

This delicious little wild child 🦖 I can’t imagine a love more intense and beautiful than what I have for you. My stars, moon, and earth. You make me so full, and happy, I just hope that I provide you the same love right back ❤️❤️❤️ #amesylove

A dainty rosy rhubarb cake is up on the blog 💞 Gluten-free, dairy-free, light and tender. This is all you could ever want in a sweet treat (plus blush-pink glaze, bc that never hurts either 💕) You can find the recipe link in my profile 🌟

One of my favorite recipes made even better this time of year. It’s a #vegan 🌱🌱SPRING onion dip 🌱🌱 the base is a mix of soaked cashews and plant-based cream cheese, along with a few other pantry staples. We lightly sauté the spring onions, and add them to the mix once cooled. It’s so delicious that you would never know it’s not the dairy version you grew up with 💛💛💛 Do yourself a favor and make a batch, then go get yourself some chips 👍🏼 (Recipe link in my profile, and a recipe step-by-step in my Stories and Highlights ☺️)

Never not craving baked goods filled with rhubarb - this gluten-free loaf has got a good bit chopped up on the inside, as well as a perfect blushy rhubarb glaze for topping 💘 The inside is moist and tender, and just the perfect bite mid-afternoon (or anytime of day, really). Look out for the recipe later this week ✌🏼

Sharing my mid-day, pick-me-up on the blog this week 💫 It’s an iced turmeric latte made with my favorite homemade, toasted almond-cashew & date milk. And it strikes the perfect creamy/toasty balance with the spices in the turmeric mix. No caffeine, but it packs a hefty punch 💥 
Oh, and a little honeysuckle garnish bc my neighbor’s yard is overflowing with them 🌼Honeysuckle will forever remind me of summers I spent on Martha’s Vineyard. They wouldn’t bloom until late June and my mom and I would seek them out all over the island just to enjoy their sweet scent. Happy Thursday, loves! 💛💛💛
(Link to both recipes in my profile)

A little bundle of what Spring is looking like in my kitchen at the moment. 
We’ve got baby cauli heads, garlic scapes (🙌🏼), chives, a big bunch of asparagus, the sweetest strawbs, rhubarb (🥰), and very new-to-me loquats 🧡

Cauli is going to be made into a mash (still trying to get Amesy to like it 🙃), half the scapes & chives went into a tahini sauce for pasta dish last night - the other half I’m going to be flavoring a fresh batch of vegan labneh with. Strawbs & rhubarb will likely go into a galette, and the loquats are for noshing on.
Ready with a fresh batch for the Battle of Winterfell tonight 💀🧟‍♂️💀🧟‍♂️ #GoT

It’s chilly and grey, Amesy was up and bouncing around our bed before 6am, and I all want to do is curl up on the couch and eat the comfort that comes with this strawberry baked French toast. But alas, we’re headed to the aquarium! 🐠🦀🐳🐙 If you’re afforded the time perhaps you’ll put this wonderful recipe to work this weekend. It’s from @loveandlemons newest book #loveandlemonseveryday and we love it! I make a gluten free version with a gf boule that is absolutely delicious 🍓🍓🍓
Recipe link in my profile 💫

Flatbread Friday! This is one of my favorite spring flatbreads: homemade vegan labneh, charred spring onions (👌🏼), fresh herbs, a sprinkle of za’atar and flaky salt. Then a drizzle of olive oil 🙌🏼⚡️💫 Happy weekend, all 💛

Favorite afternoon treat of late: a quick blend of water, turmeric powder (I just started using @diasporaco and love it), ground ginger, a splash of maple, and a few grinds of black pepper. Throw that over some ice, and homemade toasted cashew-date milk and you’re in for a good time 💛🧡💛
Happy Easter 🐇🐣🐰 We’re heading out for brunch, but if we were home we’d be feasting on this strawberry baked French toast from the new @loveandlemons cookbook - it’s sooo delicious 😋🍓🍞

Happy Saturday 🙌🏼 I’m going to be in the kitchen most of the day baking some treats for Passover dessert tonight. Planning on having Amesy help, but we’ll see what happens 🙃🙃 Anywho, we’re going to make flourless chocolate chip cookies for the kiddos, and a flourless chocolate cake with roasted berries for the grownups 💫 Hope you’re all having a wonderful start to the holiday weekend 😘

Silky smooth, (cashew) cream of asparagus & spring onion soup 💜💚
We add a good bit of soaked cashews to the mix, to turn a not-so-creamy asparagus soup into a super lush soup - dream scenario 👌🏼👌🏼👌🏼 Recipe link in my profile 💚💚💚

Perfect weeknight meal: @hettymckinnon ‘s deconstructed falafel salad from her #familythecookbook. Instead of making falafel, we roast the chickpeas in olive oil and falafel spices. They’re  served over the salad warm with sautéed kale, bright herbs, and a zingy lemon tahini sauce (I also added some pickled red onions that I had in the fridge)💥 I’m so excited to be sharing the recipe over the blog -  get the link in my profile 💫💫💫

Happy Friday from my little kitchen corner 🤗 💫 This is easily my favorite spot in the house (i.e. the one place no one else occupies and the one spot Amesy can’t get to easily). It houses some of my treasured cutting boards, special knick-knacks, and some new Spring cookbooks that I can stop reading through - which are filled with accessible recipes, gorgeous photography, touching stories, and endless inspiration. You should definitely check them out! 📚(Tap for sources/authors)

🚨VEGAN LABNEH alert 🚨! Super excited to share this one with you! It’s uncomplicated, delicious (!!!), and there’s about a million and one ways you can use it 🤘🏼 I’ve got a step-by-step, how-to on my site this week, along with a few of my favorite ways to prepare it, including this dip ☝🏼 It’s got toasted pistachios, fresh spring herbs, za’atar, a good glug of EVOO, and flaky salt ✨✨✨
Recipes are linked in my profile 🔗

Herbed Tahini & Peas Pasta from @arthurstreetkitchen ‘s beautiful book, Family 💚 It’s got fresh sugar snap peas, peas, and the most delightful herbed tahini sauce w/ mint & parsley that I could literally drink all day long. Basically a Spring dream in a bowl 🌱 Thank you for this deliciousness Hetty ❤️

Good morning! 🌞 #vegan labneh & jam on toast for the everyday, please! I’m working on a pretty comprehensive blog post on how I make the labneh - what plant-based yogurt I use, what’s added, how long it takes to make, etc! Plus, some of my favorite uses for it 😉 Should be up on my site this coming week, be on the lookout 👀

Fresh up on the site: Garlic ‘N Herb Cauliflower Rice w/ Spring Greens 🍚 🌱🍚🌱🍚🌱🍚 Maybe I’m the last one to crack the code on preparing cauli rice that I actually want to eat 🤷🏻‍♀️ But, using butter (in this case #vegan @miyokoscreamery butter) in place of olive oil made such an incredible difference, true believer this time around 🙌🏼 Recipe link in my profile 🤗 Happy Friday!!!
Dinner prep - cauli rice w/ chopped chives, lots of garlic, pea shoots, olive oil, lemon juice, s &p. Spring has most definitely found its way to LA, hope it reaches you soon too 😘💚

What started as just futzing around with a #vegan labneh, turned into one of my best (and easiest) kitchen successes 👏🏼👏🏼👏🏼
I started with a Greek-style plant-based yogurt, gave it a 24-hour rest in a nut milk bag w/ a bit of salt & lemon juice, and then BAM a day later I had a thick, tangy, creamy labneh. 
Finished it off with chopped parsley & pistachios, olive oil, and flaky sea salt 🤤 Planning on dipping all the things for dinner 👌🏼
Overnight vanilla chia oats, quick-stewed raspberries, big plop of almond butter, extra almond milk. That’s how we’re doing Sunday this morning 👊🏼

Celebrating the first Spring weekend with a Green & White Socca Pizza 🍕 💚🍕💚
It’s filled with herbs, spinach and garlic, and then topped with almond ricotta, baby greens, and toasty pine nuts 😋 Recipe is up on the blog today! Get the link in my profile ❤️

Golden falafel tacos with avocado,  radish, and cilantro salad with a heavy drizzle of tahini sauce 💥🌮💥🌮💥
#tacotuesday

It’s the last day of February which means we’re that much closer to Spring (☔️🌱🌷)! So it’s only natural that we celebrate with some homemade 🎉party mix 🎉! It’s a dry-roasted, tamari nut & pretzel blend, basically a little flavor bomb with every bite. Super easy to make - 3 ingredients, and all that’s required is an oven and some baking sheets 👌🏼 Get the recipe link in my profile, and a quick bts of how I make this party mix in my Stories (which I’ll also save to my Highlights 😉). ❤️

We’re making avocado pesto from the blog (because there’s nothing I look forward least than cooking on a Monday night 🙃)! I try to set myself up with some sort of basic sauce/stew/soup that I add to something I’ve picked up or prepped over the weekend. 🥑
Tonight it’s this creamy (vegan) avocado pesto. Tossing some ingredients into a food processor and topping pasta with it is just enough cooking without an exhaustive effort. 🥑
These are the basic ingredients, but I also saved a little behind the scenes video in my highlights too if you’re interested 😉 And you can always search: “avocado pesto” on my site for the full recipe 😘

Party mixin’ for the Oscars! We got almonds, pecans, cashews, peanuts, and GF pretzels. Gave the nuts a quick roast (then turned off the oven), mixed in some GF tamari (& the pretzels), set them back in the warm oven to dry everything out. And that’s it! Basically 3 ingredients and 30 mins for a bangin’ little snack 🥨🥜🥨🥜🥨🥜 (ps I’m a little embarrassed to admit how excited I was when I heard that Gaga & Cooper were going to perform a duet tonight. Eeee, kinda can’t wait! 😬🥰)

Extra tall stack of these grain-free banana pancakes this morning 🥞. Made with banana, eggs, almond & coconut flour. They’re tender, and fluffy, and crisp on edges - nothing more you could ask for on a Sunday morning 🌞💫⭐️ (Recipe on the blog, search: pumpkin spice banana bread pancakes 😊.)

I’ve lost count of how many consecutive days it’s rained here in LA and I’m not complaining! More reason to snuggle down and eat grilled cheese and soup for the ultimate cozy dinner. Happy weekend, friends! I hope you’re staying warm and dry 💞

BLACKOUT BANANA BREAD CAKE alert! Hands down my favorite thing to snack on these days, especially since it’s all 💕❤️💕❤️💕 this month. Just go give yourself a hug in the form of cake and never look back! Go grab the recipe in my profile, loves! 🥰🥰🥰🥰

I'm always on the lookout for a salad that's fun and flavorful. 🥗 Whether that's adding caramelized onions, creamy dressings, spiced nuts, or some punchy chopped fruit. While delicious, Caesar salads are drowned in dressing and covered with cheese. So I’ve partnered with @wholefoods in the spirit of the the New Year to show you #HowIJanuary and I’ve remixed this classic salad to help you enjoy it in a new and delicious way. I pared down your typical Caesar to still offer all that creamy goodness with a vegan dressing, some gluten-free croutons, and I swapped in shaved brussels sprouts because they're a good source of fiber and hold up in the fridge for a few days. Follow the link in my profile to find more gluten-free options for you to add to your meals! #Sponsored #MakesMeWhole

Here's the recipe below:

RECIPE:
Brussels Sprouts Caesar Salad: -2lbs. brussels sprouts, shaved thin on a mandolin or with a sharp knife
- drizzle extra virgin olive oil
- squeeze lemon juice
- fat pinch salt
-1 ripe avocado, sliced
- gluten-free croutons (optional)
- walnuts shaved on a microplane, to garnish (optional) 
Dressing: -1/2 c Plain Kite Hill Greek-style yogurt
-1 tablespoon lemon juice
-1 tablespoon apple cider vinegar
-1 1/2 tablespoons nutritional yeast
-2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
-2 teaspoons capers
-1 clove garlic, grated on a microplane
-Salt & pepper, to taste
-1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil 
1. Toss shaved brussels sprouts with the olive oil, lemon juice, and salt.  Use your hands and mix everything together for about 1 minute.  Set aside.
2. Make the dressing.  In a food processor fitted with a metal “s” blade, combine the yogurt, lemon juice, vinegar, nutritional yeast, Dijon, capers, garlic, and salt and pepper to taste.  With the machine running drizzle in the ¼ cup of olive oil until everything is combined.  Remove the lid and check the dressing, if it’s too thick, add the extra 2 tablespoons of olive oil and combine once again.  Taste and adjust salt if needed. 
3. To the shaved brussels sprouts, add roughly half the dressing and mix.  Taste, and add more dressing and salt if needed.  Top w/ sliced avocado, gf croutons & shaved walnuts

There’s a new recipe up on the blog! A golden cauliflower kabocha squash soup w/ warming spices (think: turmeric & ginger), and a punch of tangy yogurt all mixed in for the ultimate cozy soup situation. 💛✨⭐️💫☀️⚡️💥 Find the recipe link in my profile 😊

Nut & seed salted cacao granola might be the most addictive thing ever. Crunch, licks of salt, toasty nuts & coconut, and a light chocolate coating that makes this feel more dessert-y when it’s actually a perfectly balanced breakfast - a dream situation, really 🙌🏼 I just sent this recipe out in my winter newsletter. But you can still have it delivered right to your inbox 📨 , (along with 2 other delicious winter-friendly dishes) via the link in my profile 🍫✨🥜🌰

It’s one of those days that cuts right through you. Chilly and wet, and there’s only one remedy as far as I’m concerned: crusty bread 🍞 (specifically the gf loaf from @gjustabakery ) & piping hot soup (especially when it’s the color of sunshine ☀️) Hope you’re all staying cozy out there! ✨✨✨

Regardless of the season, I always keep cookies on hand. I’ve teamed up with @wholefoods to show some of my favorite picks for the New Year and this recipe is one of my all-time go-to options. I particularly like having these almond butter cookies around –they're full of fats from almond butter, and they're made with monkfruit sweetener, which can replace added sugars. But they totally fill the 3-4pm void when I need a cookie! Get the recipe for these delicious babes below!  #Sponsored @wholefoods #HowIJanuary #MakesMeWhole
RECIPE:

Almond Butter Cookies: - 1 1/4 cups almond butter
- 1/2 cup monkfruit sweetener
- 1 large egg
- flaky sea salt, for topping 
1. Preheat oven to 350°F and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.  Set aside.
2. In a large bowl, mix together the almond butter, sweetener, and egg until thoroughly combined. 
3. Using a cookie scoop, or by hand, portion the cookie dough into 1 ½ tablespoon balls and place them on your cookie sheet leaving about an inch between each cookie.  Using a fork, gently press the cookies cookies down making an imprint. 
4. Bake the cookies for 12-14 minutes.  Let cool completely before eating. 🍪🍪🍪

New favorite tea paired with my new favorite milk: @sakaralife detox tea (which I’ve been loving to drink each afternoon), and a vanilla, coconut, cashew blend of homemade milk that’s been hitting the spot lately. 
The tea has rooibos, lemongrass, and rose which is so good on its own. But that little hit of creamy coconut-y milk takes it up a teeny notch. 
Here’s a rough sketch of a recipe for the milk:
• 1/2 cup raw cashews (soaked 3 hrs)
• 1/2 cup coconut flakes
• 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
• pinch of salt
• 3 cups filtered water
Blend on high for 1-2 mins, until frothy. Strain through a nut milk bag (I did a double strain), and store in a air tight jar for up to 2 days 🥛💫🤗
Our new way to Caesar is an all brussels sprout version. No apologies for loving shaved brussels in 2019 (or ever) 🥳💪🏼

Getting back to the basics with my typical grocery #wholefoodshaul for about 3-4 days. I’m teaming up with @wholefoods to show you my favorite staples for the new year. 
Buying all of our groceries and prepping for an entire week has never worked for us. Instead I buy groceries for 3-4 days.  Our schedules inevitably shift and change depending on the week, so this little system actually saves us money and our food never goes bad. 
Believe it or not, this is what groceries look like around here regardless of what month it is.  December looks pretty much the same as January.  I make meals that simply make us feel good, and if they don’t, then they don’t have a place in our home.  I love this way of eating - no cleanses, detoxes, or diets when the new year rolls around, just back to the basics that nourish us. #Sponsored #HowIJanuary #MakesMeWhole 💪🏼🌈✨

There’s still time to make this all vegan cheese board! 🌱🧀 Grab some crackers, your favorite vegan cheeses, fruit, nuts, compotes/preserves/conserves, and you’re good to go! 🍇🥖🧀🌰🥂🍾 Happiest 2019 to you all! So grateful to share this little corner of the crazy thing that is Instagram with you 🥳🥳🥳

This weekend was crazy, on both ends of the spectrum! Successfully got a cute little Xmas tree 🌲, AND transitioned Amesy to his big boy-ish bed (TBH, he’s been sleeping on his own for afternoon naps at school, so his teachers really deserve all the credit 🙏🏼). And on the crap end we had a pretty serious gas leak under our house. Frank always teases me for my insane sense of smell. But we were both very thankful for it yesterday. Our local fire department and gas company reacted quickly and worked late into the night to get everything under control, thank goodness. Feeling especially thankful for the people in our lives (who can can sometimes be overlooked), who protect us and keep us safe ❤️❤️❤️ There was also this yummy vegan cheese board, but it kinda pales in comparison to everything else 🍇🌱🧀 ✨
The most basic of all toasts, but so freakin good: a big swirl of almond butter & flaky sea salt. Happy Saturday babes 💫⭐️⚡️✨

Inside out chocolate chunk cookie bars w/ perfect little chocolate puddles in each bite. ✨

(In partnership with @CountryCrock) I'm a creature of habit, so when the holidays roll around what I get excited about most is our holiday traditions. 💫 
On Christmas morning when I was growing up my mom would set our living room coffee table with Christmas cookies, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, and sometimes this would include a very low key breakfast cake.  And since Amesy loves "cick, cick, cick!" (cake), I'm continuing the tradition in our little family. 👪This is a bit of a tease, but I'm excited to share this recipe with you soon!  Hint: it involves crumbs and cranberries.🎄🎄#FamilyToTable
Pan-baked, inside out chocolate chip cookies w/ flaky sea, of course 💫🍪🖤 I love you, cookie season 😚
